from my =

ap (enabled if there is an image

How is the texture map input into the CPPN?  I like what it=
 does but

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "William Monti" <william.monti@..=
.> 
wrote:
>
> Hello!
> 
> I am a student of Artificial Intelligence, and I=
 have been 
researching
> about it for the last years, after some implement=
ations I am 
releasing
> my last one based on the idea of Genetic Art Tool =
by Mattias
> Fagerlund.
> 
> The project website is http://sourceforge.net/=
projects/jcppn (there
> are some generated images on the screenshot section=
)
> 
> Below are some of the main differences on my implementation:
>  - Us=
e of HSL color scheme instead of RGB, what gives more natural 
colors
>  - =
Use of perlin noises as a type of a transfer function instead of
> applying=
 it to input coordinates (the transfer functions used are:
> sigmoid, gauss=
, perlin, cosine, inverse and binary)
>  - Use of textures as an input map =
(enabled if there is an image 
file
> named "txt1.png" on the "c:\jccpn\inp=
ut" folder)
> 
> It is just a preview version, I still need to work improvi=
ng the
> usability and add more features to it (I already made it produce 3=
D
> model textures to apply on an avatar skin/clothing)
> 
> To run it, use=
 the following command line:
> java -Xmx256M -jar jcppn.jar
> (It will work=
 if you double click on the jar file, but it will lack
> memory while savin=
g images).
> 
> Here is a brief overview of the GUI:
>  - The numbers on ea=
ch image is the specie #
>  - Use the slider of each image to define its fi=
tness, the checkbox
> will mark the organism for elitism, copying it to the=
 next 
generation
>  - Click on an image to open the god mode window
>  - T=
he Generate button will evolve the generation
>  - The load button will loa=
d a previously saved .org file (there 
are
> some files attached to this e-=
mail)
> God Mode:
>  - Click on the image to save it do disk (an organism f=
ile and a
> 1024x1024 png image, it will take some time to render it, pleas=
e 
wait for
> the "Images saved" message box)
>  - The weights of the netwo=
rk are shown on the middle pane, and the
> connections on the right one.
> =

> Known issues:
>  - There are some memory leaks while rendering the image=
s, if you 
get
> problems of the image not being saved, close the program a=
nd reopen
> it. (The organism file will be always saved, so you can restore=
 
your
> work on the new session).
> 
> Regards,
> William Monti
>
